title: Droven greatsword
data:
| )                |                                                               |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name             | droven greatsword                                             |
| Appearance       | two-handed sword                                              |
| Damage vs. small | 1d18                                                          |
| Damage vs. large | 1d30                                                          |
| To-hit bonus     | +2                                                            |
| Weapon skill     | [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") |
| Size             | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")                   |
| Base price       | 50 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant)       |
| Weight           | [120](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                  |
| Material         | [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian")                         |

A **droven greatsword** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). It is a [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") weapon that uses the [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). It has a [default material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian"), and appears as a "two-handed sword" with its material displayed when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[The Sceptre of Lolth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Sceptre_of_Lolth "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") that can take the form of a droven greatsword.

## Generation

Droven greatswords are not randomly generated. [Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNetHack "Drow (starting race)") [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero") start with knowledge of the droven greatsword, and hedrow [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") start with a non-cursed droven greatsword.

Several [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") can be [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") droven greatswords:

- [Hedrow blademasters](/wiki/Hedrow_blademaster "Hedrow blademaster") always generate with a +4 droven greatsword that has a 3⁄4 chance of being [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep")-poisoned, and will otherwise be [paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis")-poisoned.
- [Y-cultist fighters](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_fighter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist fighter (page does not exist)") and other drow that do not have a defined starting inventory have an effective 1⁄12 chance of generating with a droven greatsword.
- [Y-cultist patrons](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_patron\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist patron (page does not exist)") always generate with a +4 droven greatsword that has a 1⁄4 chance of being [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness")-poisoned, a 1⁄2 chance of being [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep")-poisoned, and a 1⁄4 chance of being [paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis")-poisoned.
- [Dokkalfar eternal matriarchs](/wiki/Dokkalfar_eternal_matriarch "Dokkalfar eternal matriarch") in the [Anachrononaut quest](/wiki/Anachrononaut_quest "Anachrononaut quest") are generated with a cursed +9 [shadowsteel](/wiki/Shadowsteel "Shadowsteel") droven greatsword that is unholy, [wrathful](/index.php?title=Wrathful\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wrathful (page does not exist)") and [faded](/index.php?title=Faded\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Faded (page does not exist)").
- [Deminymphs](/wiki/Deminymph "Deminymph") that are randomly generated outside of the Drow Healer quest or the Lost Cities have an effective 1⁄320 chance of being given a madperson kit with a droven greatsword that has an enchantment of +2 to +4, a 1⁄100 chance of being [mercurial](/wiki/Mercurial "Mercurial") and a 1⁄20 chance of being made into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact").

* *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Droven_greatsword\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Droven greatsword

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)  
Name droven greatsword
Appearance two-handed sword
Damage vs. small 1d18
Damage vs. large 1d30
To-hit bonus +2
Weapon skill two-handed sword
Size one-handed
Base price 50 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 120
Material obsidian

A droven greatsword is a type of weapon that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. It is a two-handed weapon that uses the two-handed sword skill. It has a default material of obsidian, and appears as a "two-handed sword" with its material displayed when unidentified.

The Sceptre of Lolth is an artifact that can take the form of a droven greatsword.

Generation

Droven greatswords are not randomly generated. Drow heroes start with knowledge of the droven greatsword, and hedrow Priests start with a non-cursed droven greatsword.

Several drow can be generated with droven greatswords:

  • Hedrow blademasters always generate with a +4 droven greatsword that has a 3⁄4 chance of being sleep-poisoned, and will otherwise be paralysis-poisoned.
  • Y-cultist fighters and other drow that do not have a defined starting inventory have an effective 1⁄12 chance of generating with a droven greatsword.
  • Y-cultist patrons always generate with a +4 droven greatsword that has a 1⁄4 chance of being sickness-poisoned, a 1⁄2 chance of being sleep-poisoned, and a 1⁄4 chance of being paralysis-poisoned.
  • Dokkalfar eternal matriarchs in the Anachrononaut quest are generated with a cursed +9 shadowsteel droven greatsword that is unholy, wrathful and faded.
  • Deminymphs that are randomly generated outside of the Drow Healer quest or the Lost Cities have an effective 1⁄320 chance of being given a madperson kit with a droven greatsword that has an enchantment of +2 to +4, a 1⁄100 chance of being mercurial and a 1⁄20 chance of being made into an artifact.
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''droven greatsword''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. It is a [[two-handed]] weapon that uses the [[two-handed sword]] [[skill]]. It has a [[Object materials (dNetHack)|default material]] of [[obsidian]], and appears as a "two-handed sword" with its material displayed when [[Identification|unidentified]].

[[dNetHack artifacts#The Sceptre of Lolth|The Sceptre of Lolth]] is an [[artifact]] that can take the form of a droven greatsword.

==Generation==
Droven greatswords are not randomly generated. [[Drow (starting race)#dNetHack|Drow]] [[hero]]es start with knowledge of the droven greatsword, and hedrow [[Priest]]s start with a non-cursed droven greatsword.

Several [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] can be [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] droven greatswords:

* [[Hedrow blademaster]]s always generate with a +4 droven greatsword that has a {{frac|3|4}} chance of being [[sleep]]-poisoned, and will otherwise be [[paralysis]]-poisoned.
* [[Y-cultist fighter]]s and other drow that do not have a defined starting inventory have an effective {{frac|12}} chance of generating with a droven greatsword.
* [[Y-cultist patron]]s always generate with a +4 droven greatsword that has a {{frac|4}} chance of being [[sickness]]-poisoned, a {{frac|2}} chance of being [[sleep]]-poisoned, and a {{frac|4}} chance of being [[paralysis]]-poisoned.
* [[Dokkalfar eternal matriarch]]s in the [[Anachrononaut quest]] are generated with a cursed +9 [[shadowsteel]] droven greatsword that is unholy, [[wrathful]] and [[faded]].
* [[Deminymph]]s that are randomly generated outside of the Drow Healer quest or the Lost Cities have an effective {{frac|320}} chance of being given a madperson kit with a droven greatsword that has an enchantment of +2 to +4, a {{frac|100}} chance of being [[mercurial]] and a {{frac|20}} chance of being made into an [[artifact]].
